content.description: An experiment was conducted to investigate whether submersion in cold water causes a lower heart rate. The experiment used <math alttext="50" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>50</mn></mrow></math> volunteers. The <math alttext="25" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>25</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> youngest volunteers had their heart rate measured while holding their breath for <math alttext="30" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>30</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> seconds with their face submerged in cold water. The <math alttext="25" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>25</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> oldest volunteers had their heart rate measured while holding their breath for <math alttext="30" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>30</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> seconds with their face not submerged in cold water. The mean heart rate for volunteers who had their face submerged in cold water was lower than the mean heart rate for volunteers who did not have their face submerged in cold water.
content.question: Which of the following elements of a well-designed experiment is missing?Comparison of at least two treatment groupsRandom assignment of treatments to experimental unitsReplication

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Identify key and relevant information to answer a question or solve a problem.
